thread.title: In Transit: Expanding Cruise Options Through the Galápagos Islands
thread.title_full: In Transit: Expanding Cruise Options Through the Galápagos Islands

author: DIANE DANIEL
title: In Transit: Expanding Cruise Options Through the Galápagos Islands
text: Expanding Cruise Options Through the Galápagos Islands SEPT. 14, 2015 See More » The 20-passenger yacht, which departs on its inaugural cruise Jan. 3, will have 10 spacious staterooms with panoramic windows, satellite TV and docking stations. Amenities include a concierge, a wet bar, a library and a fitness center, along with indoor and outdoor observation areas. Two seven-night itineraries include twice-daily excursions with optional snorkel and kayak tours led by two on-board certified naturalists. Excursions are organized in groups of no more than 10 passengers per naturalist. MV Origin’s route will allow guests to view marine iguanas, Darwin finches and giant land tortoises. The starting rate for double occupancy is $6,500. A version of this article appears in print on September 13, 2015, on page TR3 of the New York edition .
